files.README.md:
# FeatBit Skills for AI Coding Agents [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) [![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-1.4.0-blue.svg)](CHANGELOG.md) > **‚ú® Universal Compatibility**: These skills work with **all AI coding agents that support the skills protocol**, including **Claude Code**, **VSCode Copilot**, **Cursor**, and other compatible agents. Install once, use everywhere! Official skills plugin for [FeatBit](https://featbit.co) - an open-source, powerful, and scalable feature flags and A/B testing platform. ## üéØ What is This? This plugin provides comprehensive knowledge and guidance for integrating FeatBit into your applications through **14 specialized skills** covering platform documentation, deployment strategies, SDK implementations, and observability across multiple programming languages and frameworks. **üîß Works with Multiple AI Agents:** - ‚úÖ **Claude Code** (Anthropic's AI assistant - inventor of the Skills protocol) - ‚úÖ **VSCode** (GitHub Copilot with Skills) - ‚úÖ **Cursor** (AI Code Editor with Skills support) - ‚úÖ **Any AI agent** that supports the Skills protocol With these skills, you can: - üöÄ Get instant guidance on feature flag implementation strategies - üîß Learn SDK integration for 7+ programming languages and 15+ frameworks - ‚òÅÔ∏è Understand deployment options: Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform - üìö Access comprehensive documentation (75+ topics) without leaving your editor - üí° Receive contextual help based on your code and questions - ‚ö° Integrate OpenFeature providers for vendor-agnostic feature flagging ## üì¶ Installation ### For Claude Code (Recommended) > **Note**: Claude Code invented the skills protocol, providing the most native and seamless experience. #### Quick Install from Marketplace Install directly from Claude Code marketplace: Install directly from Claude Code marketplace: ```bash # In Claude Code /plugin marketplace add featbit/featbit-skills /plugin install featbit-skills@featbit-marketplace ``` That's it! All 13 skills are now available in Claude Code. #### Verify Installation ```bash /plugin list ``` You should see `featbit-skills` with status "Enabled". ### For VSCode (GitHub Copilot) 1. Install the skills in your GitHub Copilot skills directory: ```bash # macOS/Linux mkdir -p ~/.github/skills git clone https://github.com/featbit/featbit-skills.git ~/.github/skills/featbit # Windows (PowerShell) mkdir -Force "$env:USERPROFILE\.github\skills" git clone https://github.com/featbit/featbit-skills.git "$env:USERPROFILE\.github\skills\featbit" ``` 2. Restart VSCode to load the skills 3. Verify the skills appear in your Copilot suggestions when working with FeatBit-related code ### For Cursor 1. Install the skills in your Cursor settings directory: ```bash # macOS/Linux mkdir -p ~/.cursor/skills git clone https://github.com/featbit/featbit-skills.git ~/.cursor/skills/featbit # Windows (PowerShell) mkdir -Force "$env:USERPROFILE\.cursor\skills" git clone https://github.com/featbit/featbit-skills.git "$env:USERPROFILE\.cursor\skills\featbit" ``` 2. Restart Cursor to load the skills 3. Verify the skills are active in your Cursor AI assistant ### Detailed Installation Guide For troubleshooting, enterprise setup, or manual installation, see the [complete installation guide](docs/INSTALLATION.md). ## üéì Available Skills This plugin includes **14 specialized skills** organized by category: ### Platform & Infrastructure #### **1. FeatBit Documentation** (`featbit-documentation`) Complete knowledge of FeatBit's official documentation covering 75+ topics: - ‚úÖ Feature flags management and targeting rules - ‚úÖ Experimentation and A/B testing workflows - ‚úÖ Relay proxy configuration and usage - ‚úÖ REST API and programmatic access - ‚úÖ IAM, security, and access control - ‚úÖ Installation and deployment guides - ‚úÖ Integrations: SSO, observability, webhooks - ‚úÖ Architecture and technical stack **Activates when**: You ask about FeatBit features, concepts, best practices, or general "how-to" questions. #### **2. FeatBit OpenTelemetry** (`featbit-opentelemetry`) Expert knowledge of FeatBit's OpenTelemetry integration for comprehensive observability: - üìä Metrics, traces, and logs instrumentation - üîß Configuration for Api, Evaluation-Server, and Data Analytic services - üê≥ Ready-to-run examples with Seq, Jaeger, and Prometheus - üîå Integration with observability backends (Datadog, New Relic, Grafana) - ‚öôÔ∏è Environment variables and collector setup - üìà Performance monitoring and troubleshooting **Activates when**: You ask about monitoring FeatBit, setting up observability, OpenTelemetry, or troubleshooting performance. **Documentation**: https://docs.featbit.co/integrations/observability/opentelemetry **Example**: "How do I set up OpenTelemetry for FeatBit services?" #### **3. FeatBit Docker Deployment** (`featbit-deployment-docker`) Expert guidance for Docker Compose deployments: - üê≥ Docker Compose configurations (Standalone, Standard, Professional) - üîß Environment variables and container orchestration - üîí Security best practices and secrets management - üíæ Backup and recovery strategies - üìä Monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana - ‚ö° Performance tuning and optimization - üåê Reverse proxy with nginx and SSL/TLS **Activates when**: Working with `docker-compose.yml`, `Dockerfile`, or Docker-based deployment questions. **Example**: "How do I deploy FeatBit with Docker Compose using MongoDB and Redis?" #### **4. FeatBit Kubernetes Deployment** (`featbit-deployment-kubernetes`) Expert guidance for Kubernetes/Helm deployments: - ‚ò∏Ô∏è Helm Charts installation and configuration - üåê Service exposure (Ingress, LoadBalancer, NodePort) - üìà Auto-scaling with HPA - ‚òÅÔ∏è Cloud provider integrations (AKS, EKS, GKE) - üîê TLS/SSL with cert-manager and Let's Encrypt - üóÑÔ∏è External database configurations - üîÑ Upgrade and rollback strategies **Activates when**: Working with `values.yaml`, Kubernetes manifests, or Helm deployment questions. **Example**: "How do I deploy FeatBit to Azure AKS with automatic SSL certificates?" --- ### Server-Side SDKs #### **5. FeatBit .NET SDK** (`featbit-dotnet-sdk`) Expert guidance for .NET Server SDK integration: - üèóÔ∏è ASP.NET Core with dependency injection - üñ•Ô∏è Console applications and worker services - üîÑ All variation types (bool, string, int, double, JSON) - üìà Custom event tracking for A/B testing - ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration via appsettings.json - üîß Best practices and troubleshooting **Activates when**: Working with `.cs`, `.csproj`, `Program.cs`, `Startup.cs` files or .NET integration questions. **Example**: "How do I integrate FeatBit in my ASP.NET Core API?" #### **6. FeatBit Node.js Server SDK** (`featbit-node-server-sdk`) Expert guidance for Node.js Server SDK: - ‚ö° Express, Koa, NestJS framework integration - üë• Multi-user server applications - üîå WebSocket and polling data synchronization - üìä Event tracking for experiments - üìò Full TypeScript support **Activates when**: Working with `server.js`, `app.js`, or Node.js backend files. **Example**: "Set up FeatBit in my Express API" #### **7. FeatBit Python SDK** (`featbit-python-sdk`) Expert guidance for Python Server SDK: - üå∂Ô∏è Flask and Django framework integration - ‚ö° FastAPI support - üîå WebSocket streaming for real-time updates - üì¥ Offline mode for degraded scenarios - üìä Event tracking and analytics **Activates when**: Working with `.py` or Python backend files. **Example**: "Integrate FeatBit with my Flask application" #### **8. FeatBit Java SDK** (`featbit-java-sdk`) Expert guidance for Java Server SDK: - Spring Boot integration - Maven and Gradle setup - Servlet applications - Offline mode and bootstrapping - üçÉ Spring Boot integration with auto-configuration - üì¶ Maven and Gradle project setup - üèóÔ∏è Multi-module project support - üîî Flag change listeners and event callbacks - üõ°Ô∏è Thread-safe operations **Activates when**: Working with `.java`, `pom.xml`, `build.gradle` files. **Example**: "How to use FeatBit in Spring Boot?" #### **9. FeatBit Go SDK** (`featbit-go-sdk`) Expert guidance for Go Server SDK: - üç∏ Gin and Echo framework integration - üåê Standard HTTP server support - üîå WebSocket streaming for real-time updates - üì¥ Offline mode support - üìä Event tracking and analytics **Activates when**: Working with `.go`, `go.mod` files. **Example**: "Integrate FeatBit in my Gin API" --- ### Client-Side SDKs #### **10. FeatBit JavaScript Client SDK** (`featbit-javascript-client-sdk`) Expert guidance for browser JavaScript SDK: - üåê Vanilla JavaScript integration - üñ•Ô∏è Browser applications (SPA, MPA) - üîÑ Real-time flag updates via WebSocket - üë§ Single-user context management - üìä Event tracking and analytics **Activates when**: Working with `.html`, browser `.js` files. **Example**: "Add feature flags to my vanilla JS app" #### **11. FeatBit React Client SDK** (`featbit-react-client-sdk`) Expert guidance for React SDK: - ‚öõÔ∏è React hooks: `useFlags()`, `useFbClient()` - üéØ Provider pattern with `FbProvider` - ‚ö° Next.js SSR/SSG integration - üìò Full TypeScript support - üîÑ Real-time flag updates - üé® Conditional rendering patterns **Activates when**: Working with `.jsx`, `.tsx`, React component files. **Example**: "Use feature flags in my React components" #### **12. FeatBit React Native SDK** (`featbit-react-native-sdk`) Expert guidance for React Native mobile SDK: - üì± iOS and Android platform support - üì≤ Device information integration - üéØ Platform-specific feature targeting - üß≠ Navigation library integration - üì¥ Offline mode support **Activates when**: Working with React Native files and mobile app development. **Example**: "Implement feature flags in my React Native iOS app" --- ### OpenFeature Providers #### **13. FeatBit OpenFeature Node.js Provider** (`featbit-openfeature-node-server`) Expert guidance for vendor-neutral feature flagging: - üåê OpenFeature standard API compliance - ‚ö° Express, Koa, NestJS integration - üîå Event handling and hooks support - üîÑ Provider switching without code changes - üõ°Ô∏è Type-safe feature flag evaluation **Activates when**: Working with OpenFeature implementations in Node.js. **Example**: "Use OpenFeature with FeatBit in my Express API" #### **14. FeatBit OpenFeature JavaScript Provider** (`featbit-openfeature-js-client`) Expert guidance for browser OpenFeature integration: - üåê Vendor-neutral browser feature flags - ‚öõÔ∏è React, Vue, Angular integration - üîÑ Standardized flag evaluation API - üîå Provider switching at runtime - üìò Full TypeScript support **Activates when**: Working with OpenFeature implementations in browsers. **Example**: "Integrate OpenFeature FeatBit provider in my React app" --- ## üí° Usage Examples Simply ask your AI coding assistant (Copilot, Cursor, Claude, etc.) questions while working in your codebase. The relevant skill will automatically activate based on your file context and questions: ### Example 1: Getting Started **You**: "How do I add feature flags to my ASP.NET Core API?" **AI Assistant** (activating `featbit-dotnet-sdk`): - OpenFeature standard API - Express, NestJS integration - Event handling - Hooks support **Activates when working with**: OpenFeature implementations in Node.js. ### 12. **FeatBit OpenFeature JavaScript Provider** (`featbit-openfeature-js-client`) Expert guidance for OpenFeature JavaScript provider: - Browser applications - Vendor-neutral API - React and Vue integration - Standardized evaluation - Provider switching **Activates when working with**: OpenFeature implementations in browsers. ## Usage Examples Simply ask your AI coding assistant questions while working in your codebase. The relevant skill will automatically activate: ### Example 1: Feature Flag Integration **You**: "How do I integrate FeatBit in my ASP.NET Core API?" **AI Assistant** (activating `featbit-dotnet-sdk`): ``` I'll help you integrate FeatBit into your ASP.NET Core API using dependency injection. 1. Install the SDK: dotnet add package FeatBit.ServerSdk 2. Configure in Program.cs: builder.Services.AddFeatBit(options => { options.EnvSecret = "your-env-secret"; options.StreamingUri = "ws://localhost:5100"; }); 3. Use in your controller: public class FeatureController : ControllerBase { private readonly IFbClient _fbClient; public FeatureController(IFbClient fbClient) { _fbClient = fbClient; } [HttpGet] public async Task GetFeature() { var user = new FbUser.Builder("user-123") .Name("John Doe") .Build(); var enabled = await _fbClient.BoolVariation("new-feature", user, false); return Ok(new { enabled }); } } ``` ### Example 2: React Hooks **You**: "Show me how to use feature flags in my React component" **AI Assistant** (activating `featbit-react-client-sdk`): ``` I'll show you how to use FeatBit with React hooks: 1. Install the SDK: npm install featbit-react-client-sdk 2. Wrap your app with FbProvider: import { FbProvider } from 'featbit-react-client-sdk'; const options = { secret: 'your-env-secret', user: { keyId: 'user-123', name: 'John Doe' } }; 3. Use flags in components: import { useFlags, useFbClient } from 'featbit-react-client-sdk'; function MyComponent() { const { 'new-ui-feature': newUI } = useFlags(); const fbClient = useFbClient(); return newUI ? : ; } ``` ### Example 3: Docker Deployment **You**: "How do I deploy FeatBit with Docker Compose?" **AI Assistant** (activating `featbit-deployment-docker`): ``` I'll guide you through deploying FeatBit in production with Docker Compose using the Standard edition: 1. Create docker-compose.yml: version: '3.8' services: featbit-api: image: featbit/featbit-api:latest environment: - POSTGRES_CONNECTION_STRING=Host=db;Database=featbit;... depends_on: - db - redis featbit-ui: image: featbit/featbit-ui:latest ports: - "8081:80" db: image: postgres:14 volumes: - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data redis: image: redis:7 2. Start the services: docker-compose up -d 3. Configure monitoring with Prometheus: [Detailed configuration...] 4. Set up backup: [Backup strategy...] ``` --- ## üéØ Key Features ### Comprehensive Coverage - **75+ Documentation Topics**: Complete platform knowledge - **7 Programming Languages**: .NET, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, Java, Go - **15+ Frameworks**: ASP.NET Core, Express, React, Next.js, Django, Flask, FastAPI, Spring Boot, Gin, Echo, React Native - **2 Deployment Methods**: Docker Compose (single-server), Kubernetes/Helm (cloud-native) ### Smart Activation Skills automatically activate based on: - üìÅ **File Context**: Working with `.cs` files triggers .NET skill - üí¨ **Question Content**: Asking about "React" triggers React skill - üîç **Code Analysis**: Your AI assistant understands your project structure ### Real-World Guidance - ‚úÖ Complete code examples with best practices - ‚úÖ Framework-specific integration patterns - ‚úÖ Common troubleshooting scenarios - ‚úÖ Production deployment strategies - ‚úÖ Performance optimization tips --- ## üìö Resources ### Official Documentation - **FeatBit Website**: [https://featbit.co](https://featbit.co) - **Official Docs**: [https://docs.featbit.co](https://docs.featbit.co) - **GitHub Repository**: [https://github.com/featbit/featbit](https://github.com/featbit/featbit) ### Support & Community - **GitHub Issues**: [Report bugs or request features](https://github.com/featbit/featbit/issues) - **Email Support**: support@featbit.co - **Community**: Join our discussions on GitHub ### SDK Repositories - **.NET**: [featbit/featbit-dotnet-sdk](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-dotnet-sdk) - **JavaScript**: [featbit/featbit-js-client-sdk](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-js-client-sdk) - **React**: [featbit/featbit-react-client-sdk](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-react-client-sdk) - **Node.js**: [featbit/featbit-node-server-sdk](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-node-server-sdk) - **Python**: [featbit/featbit-python-sdk](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-python-sdk) - **Java**: [featbit/featbit-java-sdk](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-java-sdk) - **Go**: [featbit/featbit-go-sdk](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-go-sdk) --- ## ü§ù Contributing We welcome contributions to improve these skills! ### How to Contribute 1. Fork the repository 2. Create a feature branch: `git checkout -b feature/improvement` 3. Make your changes 4. Test thoroughly 5. Submit a pull request ### Areas for Contribution - üìñ Documentation improvements - üêõ Bug fixes in skill content - ‚ú® New code examples - üåê Additional language support - üîß Better activation patterns See [CONTRIBUTING.md](docs/CONTRIBUTING.md) for detailed guidelines. --- ## üìù License This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details. --- ## üîÑ Changelog See [CHANGELOG.md](CHANGELOG.md) for version history and release notes. --- ## ‚ùì FAQ ### Q: Do I need a FeatBit account to use these skills? **A**: The skills provide knowledge and guidance without requiring an account. However, to actually use FeatBit, you'll need to deploy your own instance or use FeatBit's cloud service. ### Q: Which skill should I use for my project? **A**: Skills activate automatically based on your file context. Just ask questions naturally, and Claude will use the appropriate skill(s). ### Q: Can I use multiple skills together? **A**: Yes! Claude can combine knowledge from multiple skills. For example, asking about "deploying a Python app with FeatBit" might use both `featbit-python-sdk` and `featbit-deployment`. ### Q: Are these skills kept up to date? **A**: We regularly update skills to match the latest FeatBit releases. Check [CHANGELOG.md](CHANGELOG.md) for update history. ### Q: How do I report an issue with a skill? **A**: Open an issue on [GitHub](https://github.com/featbit/featbit-skills/issues) with details about the problem. ---

Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by the FeatBit Team
Website ‚Ä¢ Documentation ‚Ä¢ GitHub

files.README.md:
# VSCode Copilot Instructions Skill

Expert guidance for building custom instructions for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code.

## üéØ What This Skill Covers

Build comprehensive custom instructions for GitHub Copilot with support for all instruction file types.

**Instruction File Types**:
- `.github/copilot-instructions.md` - Always-on workspace instructions
- `.instructions.md` - Conditional instructions with `applyTo` glob patterns
- `AGENTS.md` - Multi-agent workspace configuration
- `.prompt.md` - Reusable on-demand prompts

**Additional Topics**:
- Variables (`${workspaceFolder}`, `${file}`, `${selection}`, `${input:name}`)
- Tool references (`#tool:files`, `#tool:githubRepo`)
- Glob patterns for conditional instructions
- Best practices and troubleshooting

**Use when**: Creating or customizing GitHub Copilot instructions, configuring Copilot Chat, or working with instruction files.

## üì¶ Installation

```bash
claude skill add --from https://github.com/featbit/coding-agent-instructions-skills
```

## üöÄ Quick Start

### Using VSCode Copilot Instructions Skill

```
You: "Create copilot instructions for my TypeScript React project"
Claude: [Activates vscode-copilot-instructions skill]
[Generates .github/copilot-instructions.md with React/TS best practices]

You: "Add conditional instructions for test files"
Claude: [Creates .instructions.md with applyTo pattern for test files]
```

### Using Claude Custom Instructions Skill
```
You: "Create copilot instructions for my TypeScript React project"
Claude: [Activates vscode-copilot-instructions skill]
[Generates .github/copilot-instructions.md with React/TS best practices]

You: "Add conditional instructions for test files"
Claude: [Creates .instructions.md with applyTo pattern for test files]

You: "Create a prompt file for generating API endpoints"
Claude: [Creates .prompt.md with YAML frontmatter and prompt template
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents-md-guide.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ prompt-files-guide.md
```
skills/vscode-copilot-instructions/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SKILL.md                                   # Main skill file
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ references/                                # Detailed guides
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ copilot-instructions-guide.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ instructions-files-guide.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents-md-guide.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ prompt-files-guide.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ variables-and-references.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ best-practices.md
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ troubleshooting.md
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ assets/templates/                          # Ready-to-use templates
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ copilot-instructions.template.md
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ instructions-file.template.md
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents.template.md
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ prompt-file.template.md
```

**Comprehensive coverage**:
- 8,000+ lines of documentation
- 4 instruction file types explained in depth
- 25+ examples across different tech stacks
- Glob pattern reference and debugging
- Complete troubleshooting guide
- Variables and tool references
- Progressive disclosure best practice
### Platform Coverage

**VSCode Copilot Instructions**:
- ‚úÖ VSCode with GitHub Copilot
- ‚úÖ GitHub.com
- ‚úÖ Visual Studio

**Claude Custom Instructions**:
- ‚úÖ Claude.ai Web
- ‚úÖ Claude Desktop (macOS, Windows, Linux)
- ‚úÖ VSCode Extensions (select)
- ‚úÖ Claude API

### Comprehensive Templates

- **Copilot**: 4 templates covering all instruction file types
- **Claude**: Developer templates, MCP configurations, project setups
- All templates include:
  - Inline documentation
  - Real-world examples
  - Common patterns
  - Best practices

## üîß Requirements

- **For VSCode Copilot Instructions**:
  - Visual Studio Code with GitHub Copilot extension
  - Settings configured (documented in skill)

- **For Claude Custom Instructions**:
  - Claude account (Free or Pro)
  - For MCP: Claude Desktop or API access
  - For Projects: Claude Pro subscription
- ‚úÖ VSCode with GitHub Copilot
- ‚úÖ GitHub.com (copilot-instructions.md)
- ‚úÖ Visual Studio

### Comprehensive Templates

4 ready-to-use templates covering all instruction file types:
- `.github/copilot-instructions.md` - Always-on instructions template
- `.instructions.md` - Conditional instructions with applyTo patterns
- `AGENTS.md` - Multi-agent workspace template
- `.prompt.md` - Reusable prompt template with YAML frontmatter

All templates include:
- Visual Studio Code with GitHub Copilot extension
- GitHub Copilot subscription (Individual, Business, or Enterprise)
- Settings configuration (documented in skill):
  - `github.copilot.chat.codeGeneration.useInstructionFiles`: true
  - `chat.includeApplyingInstructions`: true
  - `chat.useAgentsMdFile`: truet preferences for Python backend work"

Claude uses claude-custom-instructions skill:
1. Guides through custom instructions structure
2. Suggests Python-specific preferences (PEP 8, type hints, pytest)
3. Recommends MCP servers:
   - Filesystem for project access
   - PostgreSQL for database queries
4. Provides complete configuration files
```

### Example 3: Set Up Multi-Agent Workspace

```
You: "Create AGENTS.md for a microservices project with multiple AI assistants"

plugins.name: vscode-copilot-instructions
plugins.description: Build custom instructions for GitHub Copilot in VSCode. Create .github/copilot-instructions.md, .instructions.md files with applyTo patterns, AGENTS.md for multi-agent workflows, and .prompt.md reusable prompts. Use when user asks to create Copilot instructions, configure Copilot chat, customize GitHub Copilot, or work with instruction files.
